column4: Could someone build a kde compressed file so I could get just one file instead of many small ones at 56k.
the files coming from synaptic are compressed already
I'm having problems finding out what all I need and at 56k withmany files it get's tedious.  I need justone file.
if there are lots of dependencies needed to install, you won't be able to skip them
I was just hoping someone could put all of them into one easy downloadable fiole.
I aamdownloading in microsoft OS and amattempting to get Linux on the net to use apt-get.
your best best, imho, is to leave it overnight while it downloads and installs.. I've had to do similar things downloading oracle 9i (300MB) over 56k modem  :D
I am downloading in microsoft OS.
I need to get my smartmodem working in Linux to use apt-get. It's the  only modem that works where I'm at.
cygwin makes life on windows easier
it's a linux-like environment for windows, http://www.cygwin.com/
If Ubuntu shows my modem installed, is it really installed?  I've had problems with other linux OSs.
I haven't used a modem on ubuntu, sorry
I understand.  The help files online saysall I have to do is install 2 files and it's installed.
